sub_title: Enzo Kok | Violinist | Student at the Conservatory of Amsterdam | Van Gogh Trio
summary:
Enzo Kok (14th of August, 2002) born and raised in Kerkrade, The Netherlands, got his first violin lesson at the age of 6 at the local music school from Ingrid Holleman. In 2011 he was admitted to the talent class of the music school where he got lessons till 2016. 

In 2016 he got accepted at the Sweelinck Academy, the school for Dutch top talent at the Conservatory of Amsterdam. He continued his lessons there with Wiesje Miedema and Eliot Lawson. 

In 2019 he started his bachelor violin study at the Conservatory of Amsterdam with Ilya Grubert and Eliot Lawson. 

In 2017 he received the ‘Labberté-Hoedemakers Award’ during the Peter de Grote Festival in Groningen, The Netherlands. In 2018 he was one of the three finalists of the Dutch Violin Competition ‘Davina van Wely’. In 2019 he received the 1st prize during the national finals of the Prinses Christina Concours.

Enzo performs several times a month in the Netherlands, where he performed several times in the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam, and abroad. He gave concerts in Germany, Luxembourg, Switzerland and Portugal. He has some upcoming concerts in the USA, Canada and Spain. 

Enzo performed several times on tv. In 2015 he was finalist in the Dutch talent show ‘Superkids’. In 2016 he became 2nd in the German version of this tv show. In 2019, the Canadian tv-channel TV5MONDE made a short documentary about Enzo for the ‘Enfants Prodiges’ tv-show. He performed several times in the Dutch main classical music tv-show ‘Podium Witteman’ and is regularly on NPO Radio 4. 

Enzo performed with several renowned musicians as: Daniel Rowland, Lisa Jacobs, Iris Hond and members of the Royal Concertgebouw Orchestra. 

He received masterclasses from famous violinists as: Vera Beths, Simone Lamsma, Peter Brunt, Lisa Jacobs, Daniel Rowland, Philippe Graffin, Isabelle van Keulen, Tim Kliphuis, and others. 

Enzo plays a violin built in 1707 by Carlo Antonio Testore, generously on loan to him by the Conservatory of Amsterdam.
